4. Cream ½ cup (115 g) of unsalted, room temperature butter and 1 ½ cups (300 grams) of sugar with a hand mixer for 3 to 5 minutes.
5. Add 3 room-temperature eggs one at a time and beat the batter until it’s smooth and creamy.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the bowl while mixing on low speed.
7. Mix in 1 ¼ cups (300 mL) of whole milk and 1 teaspoon (5 milliliters) of vanilla.
8. Divide the batter evenly between the cake pans and drop the pans on a hard surface to get rid of any air bubbles.
9. Bake the cakes for 25 to 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. Let the cakes cool for 15 minutes before removing them from the pans.

1. Cut one of the 40-inch (100 cm) wooden dowels to be about 6 inches (15 cm) shorter than the other.

10. Lay the frame on top of the sheet and line the inside of each dowel with hot glue.
11. Fold the excess plastic over the dowel and press it into the hot glue.
12. Tie a piece of string to the end of one of the dowels and run the other end to the opposite end of the dowel, tying it there.
13. Repeat the process with the other dowel and a second piece of string.
14. Tie the 2 lengths of string to a third piece of string at the junction where the 2 strings meet to make the bridle and line.
